file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-50-01-04 - ANTI-BLOCKAGE BARRIER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL ANTI-BLOCKAGE BARRIER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the baggage-compartment anti-blockage barrier. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT ANTI- ALL 25-50-01-000-801-A BLOCKAGE BARRIER - REMOVAL BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT ANTI- ALL 25-50-01-400-801-A BLOCKAGE BARRIER - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 25-50-01 Page 1 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-50-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT ANTI-BLOCKAGE BARRIER - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the baggage-compartment anti-blockage barrier. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 52-30-00/1 SB145-25-0087 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Baggage compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Open the baggage door (AMM SDS 52-30-00/1). J. Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) On aircraft PRE-MOD SB145-25-0087, do the steps (a) through (f) below (Figure 401): (a) Release the tie down fittings (14) and (18) from the anchor plates (13) and (20). Refer Figure 401, sheet 3). (b) Release the hook (12) from the cargo-net adapter assembly (6). Refer DET. F, Figure 401, sheet 2. (c) Remove the anti-blockage barrier (1) from the net beam assembly (7) (refer Figure 401, sheet 1) as follows: EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-50-01 Page 2 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL • Remove the cotter pin (5) and headed pin (3). • Remove the pulley (2) from the pulley housing (4). • Remove the anti-blockage barrier (1). (d) If it is necessary to remove the net beam assembly (7), (refer DET. C, Figure 401, sheet 1) do the steps below: • Release the bolts (9), washers (10), and spacers (11) that attach the upper attach bracket assembly (8). • Remove the net beam assembly (7) from the upper attach bracket assemblies (8). NOTE: When the step above is done, the cargo-net adapter assembly (6) is released. (e) If it is necessary to remove the floor anchor-plate assembly (13), (refer Figure 401, sheet 3) do the steps below: • Remove the screws (17). • Remove the anchor plate (16) and the anchor plate cup (15). (f) If it is necessary to remove the anchor plate assembly (20) from the baggage lining or from the baggage loading/unloading ramp, (refer DET. K, Figure 401, sheet 3) do the steps below: • Remove the screws (19). • Remove the anchor plate (20). (2) On aircraft POST-MOD SB145-25-0087, do the steps (a) through (e) below (Figure 402): (a) Release the tie down fittings (14) and (18) from the anchor plates (13) and (20). Refer Figure 402, sheet 3. (b) Remove the anti-blockage barrier (1) from the net beam assembly (7) (refer Figure 402, sheet 1) as follows: • Remove the headed pin (3) with the cotter pin (5). • Remove the pulley (2) from the pulley housing (4). • Remove the anti-blockage barrier (1). (c) If it is necessary to remove the net beam assembly (7), (refer DET. C, Figure 402, sheet 1) do the steps below: • Release the upper attach bracket assembly (8) with the bolts (9), washers (10), and spacers (11). • Remove the net beam assembly (7) from the upper attach bracket assembly (8). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-50-01 Page 3 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL NOTE: When the step above is done, the cargo-net adapter assembly (6) will be released. (d) If it is necessary to remove the floor anchor-plate assembly (13), (refer Figure 402, sheet 3) do the steps below: • Remove the screws (17). • Remove the anchor plate (16) and the anchor plate cup (15). (e) If it is necessary to remove the anchor plate assembly (20) from the baggage lining or from the baggage loading/unloading ramp, (refer DET. J, Figure 402, sheet 3) do the steps below: • Remove the screws (19). • Remove the anchor plate (20). AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-50-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT ANTI-BLOCKAGE BARRIER - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the baggage-compartment anti-blockage barrier. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 52-30-00/1 SB145-25-0087 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Baggage compartment I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) On aircraft PRE-MOD SB145-25-0087, do the steps (a) through (f) below (Figure 401): (a) If you removed the anchor plate assembly (20) from the baggage lining or from the baggage loading/unloading ramp, (refer DET. K, Figure 401, sheet 3) install it again, as follows: • Install the anchor plate (20). • Attach it with the screws (19). (b) If you removed the floor anchor-plate assembly (13), (refer, Figure 401, sheet 3) install it as follows: • Install the anchor plate cup (15) and the anchor plate (16). • Attach them with the screws (17). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-50-01 Page 11 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (c) If you removed the net beam assembly (7), (refer DET. C, Figure 401, sheet 1) install it as follows: • Install the cargo-net adapter assembly (6) on the upper attach bracket assembly (8). • Install the net beam assembly (7) into the upper attach bracket assembly (8). • Install the upper attach bracket assembly (8) with the spacers (11), washers (10), and bolts (9). (d) Install the anti-blockage barrier (1) on the net beam assembly (7) (refer Figure 401, sheet 1) as follows: • Install the pulley (2) in the pulley housing (4). • Install the headed pin (3) with the cotter pin (5). NOTE: The pulley (2) must run over the net beam assembly (7). (e) Tighten the hook (12) to the cargo-net adapter assembly (6). Refer DET. F, Figure 401, sheet 2. (f) Tighten the tie down fittings (14) and (18) of the anchor plates (13) and (20). Refer Figure 401, sheet 3. (2) On aircraft POST-MOD SB145-25-0087, do the steps (a) through (e) below (Figure 402): (a) If you removed the anchor plate assembly (20) from the baggage lining or from the baggage loading/unloading ramp, (refer DET. J, Figure 402, sheet 3) install it as follows: • Install the anchor plate (20). • Attach it with the screws (19). (b) If you removed the floor anchor-plate assembly (13), (refer Figure 402, sheet 3) install it as follows: • Install the anchor plate cup (15) and the anchor plate (16). • Attach them with the screws (17). (c) If you removed the net beam assembly (7), (refer DET. C, Figure 402, sheet 1) install it as follows: • Install the cargo-net adapter assembly (6) on the upper attach bracket assembly (8). • Install the net beam assembly (7) into the upper attach bracket assembly (8). • Install the upper attach bracket assembly (8) with the spacers (11), washers (10), and bolts (9). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-50-01 Page 12 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (d) Install the anti-blockage barrier (1) on the net beam assembly (7) (refer Figure 402, sheet 1 as follows: • Install the pulley (2) in the pulley housing (4). • Install the headed pin (3) with the cotter pin (5). NOTE: The pulley (2) must run over the net beam assembly (7). (e) Tighten the tie down fittings (14) and (18) of the anchor plates (13) and (20). Refer Figure 402, sheet 3. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close the baggage door (AMM SDS 52-30-00/1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-50-01 Page 13 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
